-- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Alexandre Devert <marmakoide@...> wrote:
>
> Hi=
,
> 
> =C2=A0I put my NEAT-based experimental setup online, here : http://w=
ww.marmakoide.org/download/research/blackbolt-neat-1.0.zip
> The archive is=
 mostly self-contained, you Python to compile the thing. Documentation incl=
uded in the package. It's a usage of NEAT, not verbatim HyperNEAT : I use i=
nput space to compute thickness of beams of a mechanical structure, not the=
 weight for a neuron network. But the principle is the same, NEAT algorithm=
 and CPPN.=C2=A0Definitely=C2=A0compile on Unix-ish systems, should compile=
 on Windows but not tested that. Call mothership if you need support, we're=
 ready ^^
> 
> Cheers,
> Alex
>

neat] Any Prior Applications of NEAT In Which The Genotype Itself Is The Ou=
tput?
>  
> 
> =C2=A0 
> 
> 
> Alex,
> If an individual maps to a point eva=
luation of the design space, and the local jacobian of the fitness landscap=
e is such that an added local gradient based sub-optimization task follows =
a trajectory resulting in an improved fitness associated w/ an updated indi=
vidual, would that satisfy the classification requirements associated w/ "i=
mplicit evolved embryogeny"? Also, would you consider uploading your update=
d version of Hyperneat used in your study to the group file repository?
> T=
hanks,
> Andy
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Alexandre Devert <marmakoid=
e@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> > =C3=82=C2=A0 I'm not 100% sure to get the whole =
meaning of your question, so I might answer a bit off-target ^^
> > 
> > =
=C3=82=C2=A0 In that paragraph about the taxonomy (end of page 4), I mentio=
n "local information". It's not a gradient, as in "gradient based optimizat=
ion", that is, a clue on the local geometry of the objective function. By "=
local information", I mean, *any* kind of local feedback of the behavior of=
 the phenotype. If we optimize a plane wing, it could be, say, the local ai=
r pressure. If we optimize a heat exchanger, it would be local heath flux. =
If we optimize a water pipe network, it would the local water flux and pres=
sure.
> > 
> > 
> > =C3=82=C2=A0Then, does this local information feeback t=
urns "external non-evolved embryogeny" into "implicit evolved embryogeny" ?=
 It's quite a fuzzy territory, if you ask me. Let's say you decode the geno=
type as a transformation of an initial phenotype to a final one. You have m=
any many ways to do this, and you can have genotype as a very flexible tran=
sformation (many many development steps, each doing small changes in all po=
ssible ways) or a very inflexible one (1 single very had-hoc transformation=
 step). So between "external non-evolved embryogeny" and "implicit evolved =
embryogeny", I believe there is a whole gradient of possibilities rather th=
an a sharp border between the two. Actually, to have a trully "implicit evo=
lved embryogeny", it would unbounded development. But in practice, allowing=
 a few steps of development brings a lot of flexibility for a genotype, so =
it's a rethoritical remark.
> > 
> > Cheers,
> > 
> > Alex
> > 
> > 
> > __=
______________________________

rom "external non-evolved embryogeny" to "implicit evolved embryogeny"? BTW=
, I am attracted to your more flexible taxonomy, as I have never been fully=
 comfortable with the spatial transformation constraint assumption.
